results.title: Desert people
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Scenes typical of the daily life of Aborigines of the Pintubi tribe in the Western Desert cultural area, showing two families: the first was filmed as they were found living in desert conditions, the second had recently settled at Warburton Mission and demonstrated how they had lived a few months earlier. A shorter version of People of the Australian Western Desert, Pts. l, 2 and 4.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Desert people
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Shows the importance of water to desert people. Compares the Tuaregs, nomadic people constantly in search of water, with the Hajputs, who are cultivators, running water through an ancient irrigation system by camel power and natural flow. This film has no English dialogue, the images speak for themselves. However, you can hear the Desert people in their native tongue.

results.title: Desert parks: the how to travel video
results.creator_credit: Outback Explorers Video Productions and Westprint Maps
results.brief_description: Crossing the Simpson Desert is one of the world’s greatest motoring adventures. The Desert National Parks of South Australia also include Innamincka Reserve and Lake Eyre. You can get there via the Birdsville, Oodnadatta and Strezlecki Tracks. But it’s rugged and isolated terrain. What if you break down? Where can you get fuel? Is it safe for the family? How much water to take? Where are the tracks? What spare parts to take? Where to get Park permits? This programme answers all these questions and more. Trip preparation, how to travel in safety, basic four-wheel drive techniques are all covered as the spectacular scenic highlights are shown and as you hear some colourful history and speak to the people that live and work there.

results.title: Desert locust
results.brief_description: An account of the life cycle, structure and behaviour of the desert locust. Follows the development of the locust through the five hopper stages when the insect goes through a state of immobility, explaining that this is the best time to destroy it. The most widely used method of destruction is hand dispersed poison mixed with a bait such as wheat bran.

results.title: Desert hearts
results.creator_credit: Donna Deitch and Desert Heart Productions
results.brief_description: Set in Nevada 1959, Helen Shaver is Vivian Bell, a repressed college professor from New York who arrives at a ranch in Reno for a temporary stay to obtain a divorce. Anticipating a quiet stay reading and preparing for the academic year she finds herself distracted and drawn to the ranch owner’s fiery step-daughter Cay Rivvers (Patricia Charbonneau). As their friendship develops and Vivian’s restrained and latent passion is unleashed, their lesbian relationship becomes an act of defiance against the accepted rules of society. The memorable soundtrack includes songs by Patsy Cline and other performers of the late 50’s. Based on the novel “Desert of the Heart” by Jane Rule.

results.title: Desert farming
results.creator_credit: Arthur G. Evans, Lou Lilly, West and Quartet Films
results.brief_description: Describes the conservation approaches and the modern technology used by scientists to convert deserts into blooming farmlands; how we have learned to bring water for irrigation, leech the soil of unwanted chemicals, and provide proper drainage. Shows machinery used, crops grown, harvesting and packaging.

results.title: Desert ecology
results.creator_credit: Walter H Berlet and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Deals with plants and animals living in a hot desert climate. Discusses the adaptations which enable them to withstand the long dry periods. Also shows daily living patterns of animals which enable them to survive in the great heat. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Desert Conquest
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The story of how the Australian Mutual Provident Society, by a scheme of mass clearing and scientific development transformed over a quarter of a million acres of desert land in South Australia into rich pasture holdings. Shows how the land was cleared and how the men and their families who worked on this project eventually settled on the reclaimed soil on farms of their own.

results.title: Desert cargo
results.creator_credit: A Vickers, Leslie Sansom, British Information Services and Vickers Films
results.brief_description: For the transportation of liquefied natural gas from Algeria to Britain the engineers of Vickers shipbuilding undertake at the Barrow Shipyard the building of a highly specialised tanker. The initial research, construction and testing that led up to the launching of the “Methane Princess” are set against the background of the scheme to bring a new source of energy to Britain and pioneer a new world industry

results.title: Desert bloom
results.creator_credit: Eugene Corr, Michael Hausman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Las Vegas at the time of the first atom bomb tests in 1951, this powerful drama examines the life of a struggling middle-class Nevada family, seen through the eyes of 13 year old Rose Chismore (Annabeth Gish). Finding life difficult with her war-scarred father (Jon Voight), Rose forms a close bond with her flamboyant Aunt Starr (Ellen Barkin) whose friendship comes at a critical time.
